article_text:
“Israel has become a deeply partisan issue for ordinary Americans as well as for politicians in Washington,” Bloomberg reports, having commissioned a poll to confirm that obvious observation:

Republicans by a ratio of more than 2-to-1 say the U.S. should support Israel even when its stances diverge with American interests, a new Bloomberg Politics poll finds. Democrats, by roughly the same ratio, say the opposite is true and that the U.S. must pursue its own interests over Israel’s.

The Bloomberg survey seems designed to...

twitter.description: Best of the Web: A new poll helps revive an ugly old slur, James Taranto writes.
twitter.creator: @jamestaranto

Democrats, by roughly the same ratio, say the opposite is true and that the U.S. must pursue its own interests over Israel’s.
“Israel has become a deeply partisan issue for ordinary Americans as well as for politicians in Washington,” Bloomberg reports, having commissioned a poll to confirm that obvious observation:Republicans by a ratio of more than 2-to-1 say the U.S. should support Israel even when its stances diverge with American interests, a new Bloomberg Politics poll finds.
